definition.procedurexml: <xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><variables><variable type="String" id="nbtSouthTagName">nbtSouthTagName</variable><variable type="String" id="nbtNorthTagName">nbtNorthTagName</variable><variable type="String" id="nbtWestTagName">nbtWestTagName</variable><variable type="String" id="nbtEastTagName">nbtEastTagName</variable><variable type="Number" id="send">send</variable><variable type="Number" id="capacity">capacity</variable></variables><block type="event_trigger" deletable="false" x="40" y="40"><field name="trigger">no_ext_trigger</field><next><block type="controls_if"><value name="IF0"><block type="logic_negate"><value name="BOOL"><block type="world_data_isremote"></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="controls_if"><value name="IF0"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">EQ</field><comment pinned="false" h="110" w="289">Set this to your GLOBAL MAP timer variable. NOTE: The timer should be run from its own procedure using the "On World Update trigger" from the main green block dropdown.</comment><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" is_player_var="false" has_entity="false"></mutation><field name="VAR">global:forgeFlow</field><comment pinned="false" h="76" w="175">Make a global trigger on world tick update for your timer.</comment></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0</field></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="block_nbt_num_set"><comment pinned="false" h="92" w="300">This will reset all cables flow direction every time the timer reaches 0. This way the direction of energy can addapt to support more than one generator.</comment><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">forgeFlow</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"></block></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"></block></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"></block></value><value name="tagValue"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0</field></block></value></block></statement><next><block type="controls_if"><value name="IF0"><block type="logic_binary_ops" inline="false"><field name="OP">AND</field><value name="A"><block type="block_energy_can_extract"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This will make sure the current block can extract energy</comment><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"></block></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"></block></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"></block></value><value name="direction"><block type="direction_unspecified"></block></value></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">GT</field><comment pinned="false" h="91" w="619">This script will only run if the cable or pipe has a forgeFlow variable higher than 0. Note that your generator source should set the first connected cable or pipe to to a high enough number to start the process of the flow numbers to update, for example set it to 1024 and it can travel 1024 blocks of cable before it can't send any more.</comment><value name="A"><block type="block_nbt_num_get"><value name="tagName"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT">forgeFlow</field></block></value><value name="x"><block type="coord_x"></block></value><value name="y"><block type="coord_y"></block></value><value name="z"><block type="coord_z"></block></value></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block
